brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of this study is to establish diagnostic and predictive biomarkers for patients with
      suspected acute stroke, that are transported by EMS as candidates for thrombolytic
      treatment. The study focuses on the ultra acute phase, <4.5 hours from symptom onset,
      including the prehospital setting. Analyses will include known biomarkers (e.g. GFAP, NR2
      peptide) and a discovery phase for novel markers. Patient outcome will be evaluated at 3
      month using the modified Rankin Scale (mRS).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Acute stroke suspected by EMS personnel

          -  Transport to tertiary hospital as possible candidate for thrombolytic treatment of
             ischemic stroke

          -  Age ≥18

          -  Successful prehospital blood sampling by EMS personnel

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Unsuccessful prehospital blood sampling by EMS personnel

study_pop.textblock:
Patients with suspected acute stroke, being transported by emergency medical services
        (EMS) to a tertiary hospital stroke center, as candidates for thrombolytic treatment of
        acute ischemic stroke.

primary_outcome.description: Metrics: Receiver operating characteristic curve analysis, sensitivity, specificity, positive predictive value, negative predictive value
primary_outcome.measure: Diagnostic accuracy of biomarkers for identifying ischemic stroke, transient ischemic attack, intracerebral hemorrhage and stroke mimics.

primary_outcome.description: Metrics: Receiver operating characteristic curve analysis, sensitivity, specificity, positive predictive value, negative predictive value
primary_outcome.measure: Predictive accuracy of biomarkers for identifying patients not responding to thrombolytic treatment.

primary_outcome.description: Metrics: Receiver operating characteristic curve analysis, sensitivity, specificity, positive predictive value, negative predictive value
primary_outcome.measure: Predictive accuracy of biomarkers for identifying patients facing hemorrhagic complications of thrombolytic treatment

primary_outcome.description: Metrics: Receiver operating characteristic curve analysis, sensitivity, specificity, positive predictive value, negative predictive value
primary_outcome.measure: Predictive accuracy of biomarkers for predicting outcome

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
